content:
Nice clash, but it's annoying in Reverse because your test cases follow a confusing pattern.

Almost all of them would match a solution where the problem is finding the index (0-indexed) of the a book that starts with the characters given. Tests 2 and 3 don't work, but 1, 2, 4, and 5 all give an answer that is also the index of one of the matches, so I was left looking for some reason to choose a particular index when there were multiples. It would be good to just rearrange the order of some of the books in these tests, so that the index is no longer matching, especially on tests 1, 2 and 4.
I added a test case and a validator for F to prevent solutions that simply do .count("F") from passing

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Keep it up!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good One

Goal
* Please change "first two digits" to "first one or two characters".

Constraints
* Please change 0 to 1. Alternatively, add cases when N = 0.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

Hello,

You said that N can go up to 100, could you do a test where that comes close. 
Also, I think that testing all possible book sections at least once would be a good option?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Sympa, petit puzzle facile

c = input()
n = int(input())
books = [book for i in range(n) if (book := input()).startswith(c) ]
print(len(books))
